metadata.synopsis: Gale finds the way Balthazar has been enchanting Moonlanterns and decides to steal some of his methodology.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *Carved into the bench's rotted surface are strange, half-faded sigils. A magic circle of some kind, thick with darkness and decay.*
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the sigil on the desk. It looks dark, evil, unsettling...

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: A ritual circle... and a complex one, at that. I've seen such a construction before, in the writings of the Weavepasha of Almraiven, though his vision was not so... tainted.

102.speaker: Gale
102.text: The sigils are written in a curious mix of tongues - ancient Calishite, Netherese, and something else I can't quite make out. If I'm reading it correctly - it was used in the creation of Moonlanterns.

90.speaker: Gale
90.text: It's been mostly drained, but even now contains a powerful dose of Shadow Weave.
90.context: NodeContext: Advising/warning the player -this is dangerous stuff

49.speaker: Gale
49.text: It's inert, if that's what you mean. But it still reeks of the Shadow Weave, and its polluting magic will continue to escape for as long as it lies abandoned here.

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: The discarded pixie corpses might still contain enough essence, and with one of the broken lantern casements...
42.context: NodeContext: Talking himself through an idea.Temptation building, he'd quite like to do this

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: Yes, I think I'd be able to craft one more lantern. And with a slight modification of the casting gesture, it might be able to wield the shadows instead of repelling them...
22.context: NodeContext: Talking himself through an idea.Temptation building, he'd quite like to do this

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: Though... Mystra's eyes may be upon me, and she'd forbid me dabbling with such magic. She'd want it destroyed. Wasted, arguably.
69.context: NodeContext: Coming back to himself after getting carried away, remembering he might get in trouble for creating the lantern. A hint he'd like you to encourage him to use it.

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: Forget what Mystra wants - think about yourself, and what Lady Shar's power could do for you, Gale. Make the Lantern - spread her will.
100.context: NodeContext: 'And rightly so' = SH turned from Shar. 'Forget what Mystra wants' = SH loyal to Shar.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Destroy this foul thing, before it pollutes any further.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Mystra's not here, and I am. I say you go for it. Craft the lantern.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Let me deal with the circle.

70.speaker: Gale
70.text: Deal with it how? I hate to pull rank, but I was once Mystra's Chosen. Destroying magic like this was my bread and butter.

31.speaker: Gale
31.text: Or did you wish to use it? I assure you - it's pointless. You'll have nothing more than a sore head and a very dissatisfied wizard to show for it.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: There's a reason you're Mystra's former Chosen. So let me handle it.

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: Oh, charming. I hope the Shadow Weave was to blame for that little outburst of unwarranted discourtesy.

64.speaker: Gale
64.text: If you think you know best, go right ahead.
64.context: NodeContext: Peeved, ready to let you mess it up

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Very well. Destroy the circle Gale.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: Some room then, if you please.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives Gale some space (excuse to have him alone in next shot)NodeContext: With a small sigh - knows this is the right thing to do but a bit disappointed nonetheless

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *It doesn't take much. The sigils fade, the circle's tainted magic dissolving harmlessly into the ether.*
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale reaches out confidently towards the sigil, focused on its destruction. The sigil flares briefly, then fades. It's extinguished.

24.speaker: Gale
24.text: Not bad for a wizard who slept through his Calishite lessons, eh?

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Fine. Go ahead Gale - craft this lantern of yours.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I'll find my own way of destroying the circle.

76.speaker: Gale
76.context: NodeContext: Muttering to himseld, peeved you didn't let him do it

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: Go ahead, then. Do your worst.
21.context: NodeContext: Mildly peeved you didn't let him do it. Doesn't think this will go well.

92.speaker: Gale
92.text: Not how I would have done it.
92.context: NodeContext: Sulky, a bit annoyed you didn't let him do it

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Pick up the ingedients. Craft the Shadow Lantern.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Attempt to use the ritual circle yourself. Craft the shadow lantern.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Attempt to craft the shadow lantern yourself.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Attempt to craft the shadow lantern yourself.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Attempt to use the ritual circle yourself. Pick up the ingredients and craft the shadow lantern.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Pick up the ingredients and attempt to craft the shadow lantern yourself.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Pick up the ingredients and attempt to craft the shadow lantern yourself.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Let's just leave the thing be.

44.speaker: Gale
44.text: Really? Sometimes your lack of impetus is quite astonishing.
44.context: NodeContext: A bit snipp, but accepting the decision

54.speaker: Player
54.text: We shouldn't interfere with it. Leave it alone.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: It's your choice Gale. Whatever you want to do.

96.speaker: Gale
96.text: Very well. Stand back, if you please.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale closes his eyes, asking himself the question - what does he want to do?

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: I'd advise against it - in your case, at least. No disrespect intended, but this is not your typical magic.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I know of the Weavepasha - you speak of Acham el Jhotos. But I don't recall seeing anything like this in his works...

9.speaker: Gale
9.text: Well, it wasn't in his published archives - it was merely a sketch. He invoked Mystra's guidance on how to complete it.

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: It was a quite fascinating design, though the version created here is a strange corruption of the Weavepasha's original intent.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *The circle's power remains. To be used, or destroyed.*

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *The circle is broken. Nothing but scuff marks on rotted wood.*

78.speaker: Player
78.text: It's time. Destroy the ritual circle, Gale.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I think you should forge the lantern, Gale.

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *You feel a tingle run down your spine. A thrill, or a shudder? When such power is now yours to command, does it really matter?*
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale smiles to himself - a job well done

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *For a moment, you feel a cold hand on your shoulder. Then, an absence. Mystra's blessing has been withdrawn, as has her approval. But the lantern... that is yours to command.*
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale frowns slightly, he wasn't expecting to lose Mystra's blessing

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *A ritual circle. Judging by the shadow sigils inscribed, it was used in the creation of Balthazar's Moonlanterns.*
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the sigil on the desk. It looks dark, evil, unsettling...

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *Though its power is weakened, you could still use the shattered pixies Balthazar discarded to craft one final lantern - not to repel the shadows, but to wield them.*

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Mystra forbids the use of such magic. She would insist the sigils be destroyed, the circle's evil dissipated. But she is not here, and you are.*

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Pick up the ingedients. Craft the Shadow Lantern.

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *It doesn't take much. The sigils fade, the circle's tainted magic dissolving harmlessly into the ether.*
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out confidently towards the sigil, focused on its destruction. The sigil flares briefly, then fades. It's extinguished.

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *For the briefest moment, you feel the touch of a reassuring hand on your shoulder. Mystra has noted your service.*
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale smiles to himself - a job well done
